intro: Cercopetalum, commonly known as the false nettle, is a genus of flowering plants in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its compound leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that often grow in clusters. The plant typically produces pods that contain seeds, and it is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Cercopetalum species are native to various regions in the Americas, particularly in the southwestern United States and Mexico. These plants are generally low-growing and have adapted to thrive in arid environments.
